1.q_string: In a simultaneous throw of two dice, what is the probability of getting a total of \(7\)?
A pair of dice is thrown and the numbers appearing have sum greater than or equal to \(10\). The probability of getting a sum of \(10\) is:

A bag contains \(4\) white, \(5\) red and \(6\) black balls. Three are drawn at random. Find the probability that (i) no ball drawn is black, (ii) exactly \(2\) are black (iii) all are of the same colour.
A bag contains \(6\) white and \(4\) red balls. Three balls are drawn at random. What is the probability that one ball is red and the other two are white?
In a lottery of \(50\) tickets numbered \(1\) to \(50\), two tickets are drawn simultaneously. The probability that both the tickets drawn have prime numbers.
Three dice are thrown together. The probability of getting a total of at least \(6\) is:
Four cards are drawn at random from a pack of \(52\) cards. The probability of getting all four cards of the same number is:
In a class, there are \(15\) boys and \(10\) girls. Three students are selected at random. The probability that \(1\) girl and \(2\) boys are selected is:
\(n\) cadets have to stand in a row. If all possible permutations are equally likely, the probability of two particular cadets standing side by side is:
The probability of getting more than seven when a pair of dice is thrown is:
A natural number is chosen at random from among the first \(500\). The probability of it being divisible by \(3\) or \(5\) is:
From a pack of \(52\) cards, two cards are drawn at random. The probability that one is an ace and the other is a king is:
If three unbiased coins are tossed, then the probabilities of getting at least two tails and at most two tails are:
If \({p}({x})=\frac{{kx}}{3}, {x}=1,2,3\) is a Probability Mass Function of \({x}\), then \({k}=\)?
\(A\) and \(B\) are two events such that \(P(A)=0.3\) and \(P(A \cup B)=0.8\). If \(A\) and \(B\) are independent, then \(P(B)\) is:
A man speaks the truth \(2\) out of \(3\) times. He picks one of the natural numbers in the set \(S=\{1,2,3,4,5,6\), \(7\}\) and reports that it is even. The probability that it is actually even is:

\(A\) and \({B}\) are two independent events in a given sample space and the probability that both \({A}\) and \({B}\) occur is \(0.16\) while the probability that neither occurs is \(0.36\), then \(P(A)\) and \(P(B)\), respectively are:

The probability that a person stopping at a gas station will ask to have his tyres checked is \(0.12\), the probability that he will ask to have his oil checked is \(0.29\) and the probability that he will ask to have them both checked is \(0.07\). The probability that a person who has his tyres checked will also have oil checked is:

Ravi and Rashmi are each holding \(2\) red cards and \(2\) black cards (all four red and all four black cards are identical). Ravi picks a card at random from Rashmi, and then Rashmi picks a card at random from Ravi. This process is repeated a second time. Let \(p\) be the probability that both have all \(4\) cards of the same colour. Then \(p\) satisfies:

A bag contains \(3 {R}\) & \(3 {G}\) balls and a person draws out \(3\) at random. He then drops \(3\) blue balls into the bag & again draws out \(3\) at random. The change that the \(3\) later balls being all of different colours is?

A bag contains \(5\) balls, three red and two white. Balls are randomly removed one at a time without replacement until all the red balls are drawn or all the white balls are drawn. The probability that the least ball drawn is white, is:
Suppose \({X}\) follows binomial distribution with parameters \(n=100\) and \(p=\frac{1}{3}\) then \({P}(x=r)\) is maximum when \(r=?\)

One ticket is selected at random from \(50\) tickets numbered \(00, 01, 02, .... 49\). Then the probability that the sum of the digits on the selected ticket is \(8\), given that the product of these digits is zero, equals:

In a certain town, \(40 \%\) of the people have brown hair, \(25 \%\) have brown eyes and \(15 \%\) have both brown hair and brown eyes. If a person selected at random from the town has brown hair, the probability that he has also brown eyes is:
Three numbers are chosen at random without replacement from \(\{1,2, \ldots, 8\).\(\}\). The probability that their minimum is \(3\), given that their maximum is \(6\) is:
The mean and standard deviation of a binomial distribution are 12 and 2 respectively. What is the number of trails?

A student takes a quiz consisting of 5 multiple choice questions. Each question has 4 possible answers. If a student is guessing the answer at random and answer to different are independent, then the probability of atleast one correct answer is:
In a Binomial distribution, the mean is three times its variance. What is the probability of exactly 3 successes out of 5 trials?
Let the random variables \(X\) follow \(B(6, p)\) If \(16 P ( X =4)= P ( X =2)\), then what is the value of \(p\)?
Find the probability of the failure, if getting 2 or 4 termed as success when a dice is thrown once.
